lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase is nearing settlements with federal authorities over its ties to Bernard L. Madoff, reaching tentative deals that would involve roughly $2 billion in penalties and a rare criminal action, Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Ben Protess report in DealBook. The government plans to use a sizable portion of the money to compensate Mr. Madoff’s victims, according to DealBook.

headline.main: JPMorgan Nears Settlement in Madoff Case
